column4: mount say a lot of things but nothing with sdb - u like a nopaste?
what does mount say?
sure
http://pastebin.com/f13a75572
the /dev/mapper-devices are all on sda - for notice
sudo fdisk -l shows the drive?
http://pastebin.com/f784255aa - yes it shows this device :/
thumb drive .... have you tried partition editor to format it instead?
i try gparted and i try mkfs on a terminal - always the same :(
bad drive?
i can use and format the drive with windows (ntfs) but i can't format under ubuntu/debian/suse with mkfs :/
is it a u3 drive?
what is an u3 drive?
its the new "secure" type of software they put on some thumb drives
no it is. it's an normal sata drive
so its not a thumb drive?
no it is an internal drive
ok, I had asked if it was a thumb drive and thought you said it was .... can you format it with ext3?
sorry for that :/ and no i cant format the drive under linux. neither with ext* nor with xfs.
hmm i switched the port on the mainboard for the satacable to sdb - now it works. i put an other device on there and it works too *confused*
strange
yes :/
